name: TransjugularIntrahepaticPortosystemicShunt
title: Transjugular Intrahepatic Portosystemic Shunt
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: The purpose of this value set is to represent clinical concepts related to Transjugular Intrahepatic Portosystemic Shunt (TIPS). TIPS is an interventional radiology procedure primarily used to manage complications of portal hypertension, such as variceal bleeding and refractory ascites, by creating a channel between the portal and hepatic veins.),(Data Element Scope: This value set includes the procedural methods, indications, and anatomical considerations associated with TIPS.),(Inclusion Criteria: (1) Acute or recurrent gastric or esophageal varicose bleeding that cannot be controlled by endoscopic or medical treatment.
or (2) cirrhosis with massive ascites leading to renal failure or electrolyte imbalance that has not improved despite active medical treatment.
or (3) Budd-chiar syndrome.),(Exclusion Criteria: No)
